title: Merlin
html:
Infamous Wizard


Mentor to Morgan Le Fay


Has lived for hundreds of years but age is finally catching up with him, sight has gotten worse and his physical shape is slowly worsening.

The thought of death scares him, he have trouble sleeping and grow paranoid, looking over his shoulder a lot.

In his dreams he starts to have visions and hear voices, offering deals in exchange for denying death.


Eventually he travels west, to the Highlands. A large island and in his dreams he is guided to a hidden temple deep beneath the earth.

The temple is made entirely out of a strange black stone.

Inside, he meets another human who he does not recognize.


"Were you told to come here?" Merlin questions

The human nods in return


A shadowy figure appears before them and talks to Merlin first. Reminds him to do his part of the deal.

Merlin nods as the shadowy figure reaches out and touches Merlin, he felt nothing at first until his left eye was pulled out.


The eye was placed in a small bowl on an altar in the temple's center.


In return, the figure offers a large chunk of the black metal the temple was built of and teaches Merlin how to melt it to liquid form, at which point he tells Merlin to drink the dark substance. Merlin does so and collapses in the end.


When he wakes up he feels like his usual self, healthy as a result of the substance he consumed.

He hid his missing eye with magic to prevent others from asking questions.


A year later his old symptoms are returning and he returns to the ancient temple in search of answers.


He finds the human he met last time in a slumber on the altar, next to the bowl with his eye still remaining, untouched by time.

He pleads to the unknown being to give him more of the black metal to prolong his life.


The figure does indeed reappear, and demands that Merlin uses a sharp shard of the black stone to stab the slumbering human through the heart. Merlin refuse at first, a life is not worth one year of living for him. But as the being promises that he'll last over a hundred years with this dose Merlin reluctantly agrees out of the fear of death but at a larger price. In addition to killing the human, he is also offering his magical powers for a spell, Merlin is indifferent in that regard and chants a spell of words he does not understand.


Before the ritual, Merlin is told to place large chunks of the strange black metal next to the body before starting with the spell. During the process the black stone turns into a black fog which enters the dead human's nostrils. Afterwards he stabs the body which twitches once as it dies.. without a sound.


As the shard touched the beating heart, it sinks into it, turning the heart black before the wound closed.


He leaves the temple a final time, leaving a body behind, and a healthy lifetime of years earned.

title: Wild Gods
html:
They are primarily worshiped by the elves in The Highlands.

They consist of:

  • The Bear
  • The Wolf
  • The Raven


The bear represent strength, courage and protectiveness.

The wolf represent agility and unity.

The raven represent intelligence and cunning.


Locations with strong magical connection are marked by a larger circle of rocks and is considered holy.


Faces of the animals are carved into trees where their blessing is required. The Wolf is commonly carved near hunting grounds while the Bear is often placed near battlefields or homes for courage and protectiveness respectively.


It is not uncommon to use the animals' parts for decoration. Raven feathers in the hair or attached to clothes is not uncommon, while necklaces of wolf/bear claws and fangs is not a rare sight among warriors either.


It is common practice to celebrate the start of a new season, usually with games relating to the gods. Games that highlight at least one of the core attributes strength, agility and intelligence. Celebration last for three days.

title: Shayn
html:
Youngest son of a noble house in the West Highlands.


Backstory

He was told to follow his older siblings who would inherit the lordship, rather than being taught politics he was raised as a warrior.

As a young teen he was already an undefeated genius who commanded his family's troops against their rivals.

But despite his best efforts, his family was relatively small and the larger families had a larger army, more influence and more gold to hire mercenaries, it was a losing battle. In desperation he turned to the gods, not none answered his prayers. Until he had visions, promises of power to protect his home in exchange for eternal service.


As such, he was guided to an ancient temple made out of black stone where he waited until an old man showed up. At which point he does not remember anything until he woke up with a shivering breath.


Powers

After becoming the first Child of the Mountain in living memory he is granted increased agility and strength and an impressive regeneration to heal himself. He was already a genius swordsman before his conversion which is heightened with his improved body.


In terms of magic he has little to offer, he can convert others to his kind but it is not a gift unique to him.

His left eye is the missing eye of Merlin, granting him improved vision in many ways.

  • He can see traces of most magic
  • He can see through most attempts at stealth
  • He can see in the dark as if it was bright as day


In short, he is a fearsome fighter without any battle related magic knowledge.

title: Uther Blackmoore
html:
King of Albion, Creator of the round table


Inherited the throne at the age of 24 after his father died from sickness. He was married to Gwain shortly after, who was merely 14 at the time.


Took Jayse Faye as a squire a year later, Jayse only being 5 at the time.


Gwain gave birth to Cyris about the same time. Who is their only child and heir to the throne.

title: The Barlows
html:
Barlow is the ruling family in INSERT NAME HERE.


Their land has a peaceful culture, there is almost no military. They are mostly farmer, smiths, hunters, fishermen. Simple and honest workers that live close to nature.


As a result, the Barlow are not nobility but rather influential land owners who are traders rather than farmers.


Previously independent but united with Camelot in order to gain protection from raiders, bandits and barbarians. The union was made formal by Gwain Barlow getting married to Uther Blackmoore.

title: Children of the Mountain
html:
The children are not as much of a race as they are a faction.

It refers to a being that has large amounts of Onyx in their body, making up the skeleton and heart.

It is primarily made up of humanoid races, though animals could be converted as well.


They have a slower heart beat which results in a lower body temperature, as a result their skin has a light blue color. In addition they are generally calmer but they are capable of all emotions on rare occasion.


The Onyx inside their bodies give them a more durable body with mending properties, they can regrow limbs given enough time. They also have a natural affinity for dark magic. They have longer lives but are not immortal, some are said to have lived a thousand years.


They do not like daylight though it does not harm them.


The children are artificially made, they cannot procreate. Any child born are born without the Onyx inside their body and are needed to be manually converted after birth.


The conversation process requires large amounts of Onyx in combination with ancients spells in their own language. Additional sacrifices may be included in special cases. It can be used for both living and dead beings.



Faith

The children worship a mysterious being who is referred to as "The Ancient One" who is their supposed creator.

There is little in terms of celebration to be had, there.


However, sometimes divine tasks are given that must be fulfilled. But generally the children are allowed to go about their lives as they wish in return.


The children are not obliged to obey the Ancient One, however they will be punished one way or another if they don't.

Not by the Ancient One, but by the other children who are generally grateful to their god.


There is a single temple dedicated to their god, hidden deep beneath the earth and entirely made out off Onyx.

"}]}
raw:
The children are not as much of a race as they are a faction.
It refers to a being that has large amounts of Onyx in their body, making up the skeleton and heart.
It is primarily made up of humanoid races, though animals could be converted as well.

They have a slower heart beat which results in a lower body temperature, as a result their skin has a light blue color. In addition they are generally calmer but they are capable of all emotions on rare occasion.

The Onyx inside their bodies give them a more durable body with mending properties, they can regrow limbs given enough time. They also have a natural affinity for dark magic. They have longer lives but are not immortal, some are said to have lived a thousand years.

They do not like daylight though it does not harm them.

The children are artificially made, they cannot procreate. Any child born are born without the Onyx inside their body and are needed to be manually converted after birth.

The conversation process requires large amounts of Onyx in combination with ancients spells in their own language. Additional sacrifices may be included in special cases. It can be used for both living and dead beings.


Faith
The children worship a mysterious being who is referred to as "The Ancient One" who is their supposed creator.
There is little in terms of celebration to be had, there.

However, sometimes divine tasks are given that must be fulfilled. But generally the children are allowed to go about their lives as they wish in return.

The children are not obliged to obey the Ancient One, however they will be punished one way or another if they don't.
Not by the Ancient One, but by the other children who are generally grateful to their god.

There is a single temple dedicated to their god, hidden deep beneath the earth and entirely made out off Onyx.

title: Elf
html:
The elves originate from the Highlands.


Their kingdom included the whole island originally, but as Black Blood appeared in the earth deep beneath the earth in the north they gradually started to avoid the north. As humans later came from the east the elves allowed them to settle without struggle, effectively putting the humans between them and the hidden Black Blood.


The elven women are the only ones capable of magic which is the reason they are regarded higher than men.

Girls have a one in ten birth rate compared to boys, making them powerful but rare.


The elves are ruled by a High Queen, whom's ancestors were blessed by the Wild Gods in ancient past.


They have a preference for bows, daggers, spears and magic.

title: Julia Faye
html:
Merlin's apprentice, Lady of house Faye.


Background


Julia's beauty offered her many suitors once she reached adulthood. Her parents allowed her to chose her own suitor, rather than arranging a marriage without her consent, on the condition that she actually had to choose. Julia would rather study than endure endless suitors, so she chose.


Due her high birth, magical talents and famed beauty she had a large quantity to choose from. She did not choose the richest, the fairest or the strongest. She chose a man named Aran, the youngest of another noble house who had fallen out of favor. He was handsome, but not a prince, he was trained to fight on the battlefield and had a respectable reputation in that regard. But mostly importantly, he was fair and grateful as Julia had bumped up his family name multiple steps by choosing him.


The one demand Julia made, was that he would take her family name rather than the other way around, it was not forbidden but highly unusual.


As such, Aran became the new Lord of the household with a higher standing than Julia. But in truth, Julia did not mind as it meant she had more time to study magic and let her husband tend to most of the daily matters. Though all of the major decisions were made by Julia as Aran knew he only had the power thanks to her and almost always took her council to heart.


Julia later gave birth to Jayse and Gawain


Despite being just over forty she looks like in her early twenties.


Abilities and Gear

During her apprenticeship under Merlin she sensed powerful magic inside her family's keep, an old heirloom used for decoration on the wall. She took it as her own. The staff was slim, yet of sturdy wood. The head of the staff had a life-life raven carved.


The staff grants her a magical ability which gives her a special connection to ravens, it grows the more time you spend with the staff and does not require you to hold onto the staff. Julia primarily uses this to look through ravens' eyes in order to spy on people, she can tell the crows where to be, but she needs to specifically look their their eyes in order to get information from a target. When she sleeps, her mind is usually in one or multiple crows.


Julia's magic primarily concerns nature. She can make things grow at an accelerated pace, make trees bend at her touch, walk on water. She is exponentially stronger close to nature. All of this is a part of her elven heritage.

title: The Feys
html:
Ancient family, originally formed by a half breed between human and elf.


After numerous generations the elven blood has faded, the only benefit being a few years longer life on average and the female line having a strong affinity for magic.


Their emblem is a raven head.


They live in a keep named Cinna.


They have a reputation for ruling with a iron fist, Julia execute criminals in public with the use of magic. A nasty sight which leaves her province with the lowest criminal rate in the kingdom out of fear. However, they had a rumor for just rule which was generally respected.


Current Members

  • Aran Faye, Lord
  • Julia Faye, Lady
  • Jayse Faye, eldest son
  • Gawain Faye

title: Orphanage
html:
Origin

Founded by a young Zayne Nyr with the purpose of turning orphans against the empire that threw them away.


He and the other survivors of his family had taken their saddlebags full coin and treasure from the royal vault before they fled and used a small portion of this to build a house in the wilderness.


Over the years they expanded this house, stitching more rooms onto the initial foundation. At this point Zayne traveled to the capital and handpicked some boys from the many overflowing orphanages. Though few at first, as the building in the wilderness grew more and more were brought.


The orphans were taught hand to hand combat along with bow, spear or sword depending on talent and preference. United by hatred for the empire and gratitude towards the Nyr family they went on raids together once manhood was reached. Their targets were almost always rich merchants who were either too arrogant to feel safe within the empire's borders, or too cheap to buy competent protection.


Second Iteration

Almost two hundred years later, Iona Nyx were put into the position of head of the family after her parents both died by sickness.

She leaned on the ancient Zayne for advise at first and continued the traditions built in the orphanage. Yet she had ambitions, ones she did not believe could be fulfilled the way they were currently operating.

As she was supposed to choose a husband to continue the family line she took the chance to kill two birds with one stone. She knew what qualities she was looking for, she needed someone of decent status and influence. She was ready to have lower standards in other areas to be realistic, but she found herself lucky as she was bewitched be an influential merchant with a position at the trade union's board.

Although neither family or orphans approved of her choice at the time, but once Iona pitched her vision she received Zayne's blessing.


The family had avoided detection by keeping their raids too infrequent for the empire to consider it worthwhile to send out men to investigate and properly deal with the situation. It was simply cheaper to accept the occasional loss. But as a result, they were barely an annoyance to the empire, if not less.


Iona sought a way to branch out.

The Orphanage begun to accept girls, which had previously not been done as boys were more fit for raids.

For most, the weapon practice were switched out for literature, history and math.

Iona then made use of her husband's many connections to get the orphans apprenticeships in whatever field they desired among the middle and lower class options.


By the time Iona's own children became old enough to go to the Imperial Academy she had successfully spread out her orphans across the empire by many stations. Not only receiving information in the form of letters but also simply having the option to visit a trained shoemaker at a whim for new shoes or a tailor for a hat. An adventure which previously had been difficult as buying shoes in bulk was certainly something that raised eyebrows.

html:

title: Jayse
html:
Sir Jayse Faye, Knight of the round table


Eldest son of Julia and Aran.


The fables of great knights, warriors and heroes had always inspired Jayse from a young age and insisted on being taught with the sword, rather than the books as was the norm for the eldest son who would inherit the Lordship. He was taught the basics by his father as soon as it was deemed reasonable. Although he seemed talented and obviously loved the art, he was also taught a base level education to not be a public shame to his name. As such, his mother made sure he was educated in reading, writing, math and how to perform noble duties such as attending to bales and general courtship.


At the age of 10, he was sent to Camelot to be taught under King Arthur each summer in order to widen his horizon. It was a favor from Arthur to his mother. How she convinced him was now known to Jayse nor the public.


In the capital he grew and flourished, and was knighted at the mere age of 16 the youngest in almost twenty years to become a knight. He was allowed to join the round table 4 years later.

title: The Highlands
html:
The highlands is a large island to the west, largely made up by rolling hills, plains, lakes, rivers and mountains.

The island is inhabited by various magical creatures in addition to elves and humans.


It is said that all magic originate from the island.


Humans dared to settle on the island a few generations back.

While there is no official hierarchy, some families are simply larger and powerful than others. Making them nobles in practice, if not in name.


While the land offer almost unrivaled soil to farm, and nature offering plenty of natural resources it came with additional dangers compared to Albion. The wilds were dangerous as such the farmers required others to keep them safe. While some of the villagers themselves take up arms, it is also made up by mercenaries, thrill seekers, hunters and those seeking glory in hopes of knighthood.


The south half of the island is largely unexplored by the humans as the elves do not allows trespassers into their kingdom. The elves have left the humans alone, an unwritten treaty remaining between them.

title: Onyx
html:
An ancient material found in very select locations, usually hidden deep beneath the earth.


The dark mineral seem like simple black rock in its raw form but when polished it easily passes as shining metal.

It is more durable than steel but not unbreakable by steel. It is also relatively light weight in comparison to steel.


Sometimes the mineral has crimson veins running through it.


Although Onyx does not have any known magical properties, those well versed in magic can sense that it is magical in origin.


Onyx is extremely rare and humans have almost never gotten their hands on it, most of the time they have merely found relics made out of the material. They have never found a source large enough to craft anything but jewels themselves.


Due the mysterious origin and dark color some believe it is demonic in origin, a cursed mineral.

title: The Ancient One
html:
Worshiped by The Children of the Mountain.


Also known as Grayson of Derbyshire, a travelling wine merchant, unheard of until recent years.


"Grayson's kegs contain more than just liquor." - Brother Marcys


Those who drink a lot tend to be the ones most desperate.


Grayson offers deals to unfortunate souls. Be it coin, revenge or otherwise.

He does not ask for physical things in return, instead he tends to require actions. Or sometimes, souls.

title: The High Queen
html:
Ruler of the elves in the Highlands, Sannah.


She has a pet piglet, it turns into a oversized boar when the queen is in danger..


Combat

Sannah's bloodline is blessed by the Wild Gods, granting her immense magical power. She can manipulate the nature around her at a whim though not any more than other elves.

She is a known shapeshifter, being able to change parts of her bodies into an animal's at will.


In battle, she primarily uses magic to enhance her physical advantages. She is most likely the best fighter in Avalon and The Highlands, even without assistance of magic.

title: Cyris Blackmoore
html:
Daughter to King Uther and Queen Gwain


She was a active child with way too much energy. When her usual lectures were over she went to the courtyard to play, not with other children or toys, she fancied weapons like her father. She was denied by the adults, but she was a charming girl with authority and managed to get her hands on a bow which seemed like the safest option as long as she had supervision.


This had a quick end once Uther learned of it. Instead, he got her teachers in both archery and martial arts to be taught properly instead. Under the condition that her other studies would be taken seriously. It proved to be a good motivator.


During her teenage years she was also allowed to tag along on missions with the round table.


She could not have the title of Knight, as it was only for males. However, she would be just as capable to lead an army with her royal title. A knighthood was not something she needed.
